results.title: Dose-dependent immunomodulatory effects of metformin on human neonatal monocyte-derived macrophages.
results.text_hl: Previous study suggests that low-dose @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ elicits an anti-@DISEASE_Inflammation @DISEASE_MESH:D007249 @@@inflammatory@@@ response, possibly through modulating macrophages, to improve disease outcome in a @SPECIES_10116 @@@rat@@@ @<m>DISEASE_Bronchopulmonary_Dysplasia</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D001997 @@@BPD@@@ model.

citations.NLM: Wang X, Liu Y, Han D, Zhong J, Yang C, Chen X. Dose-dependent immunomodulatory effects of metformin on human neonatal monocyte-derived macrophages. Cell Immunol. 2022 Jul;377():104557. PMID: 35679651
citations.BibTeX: @article{35679651, title={Dose-dependent immunomodulatory effects of metformin on human neonatal monocyte-derived macrophages.}, author={Wang X and Liu Y and Han D and Zhong J and Yang C and Chen X}, journal={Cell Immunol}, volume={377}, pages={104557}}

results.title: Metformin regulates macrophage polarization via the Shh signaling pathway to improve pulmonary vascular development in bronchopulmonary dysplasia.
results.text_hl: @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@Metformin@@@ regulates macrophage polarization via the @GENE_SHH @GENE_20423 @@@Shh@@@ signaling pathway to improve pulmonary vascular development in @<m>DISEASE_Bronchopulmonary_Dysplasia</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D001997 @@@bronchopulmonary dysplasia@@@.

citations.NLM: Xiang X, Zhou L, Lin Z, Qu X, Chen Y, Xia H. Metformin regulates macrophage polarization via the Shh signaling pathway to improve pulmonary vascular development in bronchopulmonary dysplasia. IUBMB Life. 2022 Mar;74(3):259-271. PMID: 34910358
citations.BibTeX: @article{34910358, title={Metformin regulates macrophage polarization via the Shh signaling pathway to improve pulmonary vascular development in bronchopulmonary dysplasia.}, author={Xiang X and Zhou L and Lin Z and Qu X and Chen Y and Xia H}, journal={IUBMB Life}, volume={74}, number={3}, pages={259-271}}

results.title: PGC-1alpha activity and mitochondrial dysfunction in preterm infants
results.text_hl: Thus, additional studies are necessary to determine whether @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ is a safe therapeutic to increase @GENE_PPARGC1A @GENE_10891 @@@PGC-1alpha@@@ activity and target the pathological processes contributing to @DISEASE_Leukoencephalopathies @DISEASE_MESH:D056784 @@@WMI@@@ and @<m>DISEASE_Bronchopulmonary_Dysplasia</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D001997 @@@BPD@@@ in neonates.

citations.NLM: Mohammadi A, Higazy R, Gauda EB. PGC-1alpha activity and mitochondrial dysfunction in preterm infants Front Physiol. 2022;13():997619. PMID: 36225305
citations.BibTeX: @article{36225305, title={PGC-1alpha activity and mitochondrial dysfunction in preterm infants}, author={Mohammadi A and Higazy R and Gauda EB}, journal={Front Physiol}, volume={13}, pages={997619}}

results.title: Metformin attenuates hyperoxia-induced lung injury in neonatal rats by reducing the inflammatory response.
results.journal: Am J Physiol Lung Cell Mol Physiol
results.text_hl: We investigated the therapeutic potential of daily treatment with 25 and 100 mg/kg @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@, injected subcutaneously in neonatal Wistar @SPECIES_10116 @@@rats@@@ with severe experimental @<m>DISEASE_Bronchopulmonary_Dysplasia</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D001997 @@@BPD@@@, induced by continuous exposure to 100% @CHEMICAL_Oxygen @CHEMICAL_MESH:D010100 @@@oxygen@@@ for 10 days.

citations.NLM: Chen X, Walther FJ, Sengers RM, Laghmani el H, Salam A, Folkerts G, Pera T, Wagenaar GT. Metformin attenuates hyperoxia-induced lung injury in neonatal rats by reducing the inflammatory response. Am J Physiol Lung Cell Mol Physiol. 2015 Aug 1;309(3):L262-70. PMID: 26047641
citations.BibTeX: @article{26047641, title={Metformin attenuates hyperoxia-induced lung injury in neonatal rats by reducing the inflammatory response.}, author={Chen X and Walther FJ and Sengers RM and Laghmani el H and Salam A and Folkerts G and Pera T and Wagenaar GT}, journal={Am J Physiol Lung Cell Mol Physiol}, volume={309}, number={3}, pages={L262-70}}
